intro: Cyrtandra × exilis, commonly known as the slender cyrtandra, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to Hawaii and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The species is known for its vibrant, often purple or blue-pink floral displays that attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments on forest floors or rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cyrtandra × exilis is considered a rare and endangered plant species.
